tag.name: section
tag.description: generic document or application section

tag.name: article
tag.description: self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site and that is intended to be independently distributable or reusable, e.g. in syndication

tag.name: aside
tag.description: a section of a page that consists of content that is tangentially related to the content around the aside element, and which could be considered separate from that content

tag.name: hgroup
tag.description: heading of a section

tag.name: header
tag.description: group of introductory or navigational aids

tag.name: footer
tag.description: a footer for its nearest ancestor sectioning content or sectioning root element

tag.name: nav
tag.description: section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page

tag.name: figure
tag.description: some flow content, optionally with a caption, that is self-contained and is typically referenced as a single unit from the main flow of the document

tag.name: figcaption
tag.description: a caption or legend for the rest of the contents of the figcaption element's parent figure element, if any

tag.name: video
tag.description: used for playing videos or movies

tag.name: audio
tag.description: a sound or audio stream

tag.name: embed
tag.description: integration point for an external application or interactive content

tag.name: mark
tag.description: a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes, due to its relevance in another context

tag.name: progress
tag.description: the completion progress of a task

tag.name: meter
tag.description: a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value

tag.name: time
tag.description: either a time on a 24 hour clock, or a precise date in the proleptic Gregorian calendar, optionally with a time and a time-zone offset

tag.name: ruby
tag.description: allows one or more spans of phrasing content to be marked with ruby annotation

tag.name: rt
tag.description: marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation

tag.name: rp
tag.description: can be used to provide parentheses around a ruby text component of a ruby annotation, to be shown by user agents that don't support ruby annotations

tag.name: canvas
tag.description: provides scripts with a resolution-dependent bitmap canvas, which can be used for rendering graphs, game graphics, or other visual images on the fly

tag.name: command
tag.description: provides scripts with a resolution-dependent bitmap canvas, which can be used for rendering graphs, game graphics, or other visual images on the fly

tag.name: datalist
tag.description: a set of option elements that represent predefined options for other controls

tag.name: keygen
tag.description: a key pair generator control

tag.name: output
tag.description: the result of a calculation

attribute.name: media
attribute.description: suppress word wrap

attribute.name: ping
attribute.description: a space-separated list of URLs which have to be pinged when the hyperlink is followed

attribute.name: hreflang
attribute.description: gives the language of the linked resource

attribute.name: charset
attribute.description: the character encoding used by the document

attribute.name: autofocus
attribute.description: allows the user to indicate that a control is to be focused as soon as the page is loaded, allowing the user to just start typing without having to manually focus the main control

attribute.name: placeholder
attribute.description: short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry

attribute.name: placeholder
attribute.description: a hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: when specified, the element is required

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: when specified, the user will be required to enter a value before submitting the form

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: disabling all its contents when specified

attribute.name: autocomplete
attribute.description: autocompletion state

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: indicate the allowed range of values for the element

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: indicate the allowed range of values for the element

attribute.name: multiple
attribute.description: whether the user is to be allowed to specify more than one value

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: regular expression against which the control's value is to be checked

attribute.name: step
attribute.description: the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value, by limiting the allowed values

attribute.name: list
attribute.description: element that lists predefined options suggested to the user

attribute.name: novalidate
attribute.description: if the form is not to be validated during submission

attribute.name: formnovalidate
attribute.description: if the form is not to be validated during submission

attribute.name: formaction
attribute.description: server-side form handler

attribute.name: formmethod
attribute.description: HTTP method used to submit the form

attribute.name: formtarget
attribute.description: render in this frame

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: kind of menu being declared

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: label of the menu

attribute.name: scoped
attribute.description: enables scoped style sheets

attribute.name: async
attribute.description: influences script loading and execution

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: address of the document's application cache manifest

attribute.name: sizes
attribute.description: the size of the referenced icon

attribute.name: reversed
attribute.description: if the list order is descending when present

attribute.name: sandbox
attribute.description: enables a set of extra restrictions on any content hosted by the iframe

attribute.name: srcdoc
attribute.description: content of the page that the nested browsing context is to contain

tag.name: bdi
tag.description: represents a span of text that is to be isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting

tag.name: details
tag.description: represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls

tag.name: source
tag.description: allows authors to specify multiple alternative media resources for media elements. It does not represent anything on its own

tag.name: summary
tag.description: represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary element's parent details element, if any

tag.name: track
tag.description: allows authors to specify explicit external timed text tracks for media elements. It does not represent anything on its own

tag.name: wbr
tag.description: represents a line break opportunity
